馬天尼斯：我愛阿仙奴但佢哋唔值得擁有我

現效力維拉的門將達米安馬天尼斯透露，離開心愛的阿仙奴是因為球會似乎對他欠缺信任。

馬天尼斯2010年以17歲之齡從獨立隊加盟阿仙奴，然後晉身一隊。他也試過被借走，2020年夏季終於正式轉會維拉。他對《天空體育》表示：「我愛阿仙奴的一切。我仍然愛他們，仍然看他們的比賽，但我只是覺得他們好像不如本應的相信我。這是事實，因為他們不斷買門將，排在我前面。我是從青訓晉升的門將呢。當我心情好時，我仍然覺得他們不值得擁有我，因為他們是這樣對我。球會不能保證我會有所需的上陣機會，因此我覺得就向前走吧。」

這位28歲門將續說阿仙奴並非講明他沒有上陣機會，但就是未能確保他想踢的比賽；效力10年後決定離開並不容易，但那是一場賭博。馬天尼斯說過加盟維拉是更進一步，他希望跟球會一同躋身歐洲賽。現時維拉在英超排名略高於阿仙奴。(Goal.com)

馬天尼斯2010年以17歲之齡從獨立隊加盟阿仙奴，然後晉身一隊。他也試過被借走，2020年夏季終於正式轉會維拉。他對《天空體育》表示：「我愛阿仙奴的一切。我仍然愛他們，仍然看他們的比賽，但我只是覺得他們好像不如本應的相信我。這是事實，因為他們不斷買門將，排在我前面。我是從青訓晉升的門將呢。當我心情好時，我仍然覺得他們不值得擁有我，因為他們是這樣對我。球會不能保證我會有所需的上陣機會，因此我覺得就向前走吧。」

這位28歲門將續說阿仙奴並非講明他沒有上陣機會，但就是未能確保他想踢的比賽；效力10年後決定離開並不容易，但那是一場賭博。馬天尼斯說過加盟維拉是更進一步，他希望跟球會一同躋身歐洲賽。現時維拉在英超排名略高於阿仙奴。(Goal.com)

replies.msg: 下年落英冠練下
有無勇士上左富咸

Gabriel Martinelli followed Bukayo Saka’s lead and signed a new deal with the club in July, with reports suggesting it could take him to 2025.

The Times initially reported that Arsenal were expecting Gabriel Martinelli to commit to a new deal, underlining their commitment to youth after the extension for Bukayo Saka.

It didn’t take long for Arsenal to confirm the contract, posting about his new ‘long-term’ deal.

Martinelli, of course, was already under contract with the club for the long term. He only joined the club in the summer of 2019, and depending on which source you believe, he either had a contract to 2023 or 2024.

The new deal reportedly takes him to 2024 with a club option to extend to 2025. At the time, that was actually the longest contract any player at Arsenal was on.

There were reasons for both sides to want to extend. Given Saka is so young, Arsenal will happily tie him down for as long as possible. For Martinelli, it’s a chance to boost his wages.

According to Football.London, Edu is working on six Arsenal deals ahead of the summer, so what are they all

Once again, we’re expecting to see quite a number of changes when the summer window opens up.

There is still some deadwood to be shifted from the club, a number of problem players to be sorted and new players to be brought in.

Football.London state that, according to the rumours doing teh rounds at the minute, Arsenal and Edu are working on at least six deals at the minute

6 Arsenal deals reportedly in the pipeline
Alexandre Lacazette
With a contract that expires next summer and no talk of a new deal, Alexandre Lacazette seems destined for the exit door this summer.

Lucas Torreira
It is unlikely that Lucas Torreira will see his loan move with Atletico Madrid turn into a permanent move but he won’t be coming back to Arsenal. As a result, either a new loan or a permanent deal needs to be found with plenty of interest reportedly coming from Italy.

Hector Bellerin
Rumour has it that Hector Bellerin wanted to leave last summer but Mikel Arteta talked him into staying another season. Now, sadly, it seems like the former Barcelona youngster’s time at the club is up.

New centre forward
Arsenal have been linked with a couple of centre forwards as they look for an Alexandre Lacazette replacement.

Top of the list at the minute seems to be Celtic’s Odsonne Edouard but they’ve also been linked with Andre Silva.

New central defender
Arsenal are also said to be in the market for a new central defender with Ibrahima Konate from Stuttgart linked.

Arsenal are also said to be trying to shift Matteo Guendouzi for £25m.

Arsenal are looking at Andre Silva as a possible replacement for Alexandre Lacazette, according to reports in Italy.

Calciomercato report that Arsenal could look to replace Alexandre Lacazette with former AC Milan striker Andre Silva, now at Frankfurt. MilanNews24 claim he’s become the Gunners’ number-one target.

Frankfurt signed Andre Silva on a three-year deal in the summer, after a decent loan spell with the club in 2019/20, and he’s really kicked on in 2020/21.

After 16 goals in 38 games for Silva last season, he’s already beaten that tally this year, bagging 20 in 23 appearances. The 25-year-old has also matched his tally of five assists from the last campaign.

There are certainly question marks over whether this represents an improvement or an outlying season.

This is by far the best year of Silva’s career and a huge step up from the two goals he scored in 25 league games with Milan. But whether it’s sustainable or not is up for debate.

The striker’s time in Serie A and La Liga was very underwhelming, and there’s a sense that he’s going through a purple patch at the moment. Six penalties have undoubtedly helped his numbers.

It’s not the first time we’ve heard of Arsenal interest in Silva, but it’s been a few years since any serious outlets reported on it. Given the source of the latest updates, we should probably wait for a more reliable outlet to weigh in.
